Package extraction

Class SpotlightThread

  • java.lang.Object
    • extraction.SpotlightThread
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Runnable

    public class SpotlightThread
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Runnable
    Performs relation extraction using the Spotlight demo for named entity recognition.
    Author:
    Lukas Blübaum, Nick Düsterhus, Monika Werner

        private java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<java.util.List<edu.stanford.nlp.util.CoreMap>> articles
        Contains sentences from the text document. Handed over by the RelationExtraction class.

      • model

        private java.io.File model

    • Constructor Detail

      • SpotlightThread

        public SpotlightThread​(NLPParser parser,
                       org.apache.jena.rdf.model.Model graph,
                       java.io.File model,
                       java.util.concurrent.BlockingQueue<java.util.List<edu.stanford.nlp.util.CoreMap>> articles)
        Constructor, initializes parser, model, graph and BlockingQueue.
        Parameters:
        parser - An instance of the NLPParser class.
        graph - An Apache Jena model this thread will write to.
        model - The file this thread will write the model to.
        articles - A BlockingQueue containing a List of CoreMaps (Stanford CoreNLP).

    • Method Detail

      • run

        public void run​()
        Takes the next line from the blocking queue, then calls getRelationsSpotlight(List) on this line. Writes the graph to a file.
        Specified by:
        run in interface java.lang.Runnable

      • getRelationsSpotlight

        private void getRelationsSpotlight​(java.util.List<edu.stanford.nlp.util.CoreMap> sentences)
        Uses the SpotlightWebservice to get the entities for the current sentences. Then calls retrieveTriples(int, Map, Map).
        Parameters:
        sentences - Current sentences that are to be processed.

      • mapEntitiesToSentences

        private java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.ArrayList<Entity>> mapEntitiesToSentences​(java.util.ArrayList<Entity> entities,
                                                                                            java.util.List<edu.stanford.nlp.util.CoreMap> sentences)
        Maps the entities back to the sentence they were found in.
        Parameters:
        entities - Entities which were found in the last call to the Spotlight demo.
        sentences - Sentences that were last send to the Spotlight demo.
        Returns:
        A HashMap with the sentence index as key and the corresponding entities as values.

      • writeTypes

        private void writeTypes​(java.lang.String response)
                 throws org.json.simple.parser.ParseException
        Writes the types for the entities into the graph.
        Parameters:
        response - Last Spotlight demo response.
        Throws:
        org.json.simple.parser.ParseException

      • retrieveTriples

        private void retrieveTriples​(int i,
                             java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Collection<edu.stanford.nlp.ie.util.RelationTriple>> binaryRelations,
                             java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.ArrayList<Entity>> entities)
        Iterates through the binary relations of a sentence and tries to map the subject and object of these to entities which were found in the current sentence. Finally tries to map the binary relation to an existing property. If there is an entity in the subject also calls literalRelation(Entity, int, Map) to search for literal relations.
        Parameters:
        i - Index of the current sentence.
        binaryRelations - List of binary relations in the current sentence.

      • literalRelation

        private void literalRelation​(Entity entity,
                             int i,
                             java.util.Map<java.lang.Integer,java.util.Collection<edu.stanford.nlp.ie.util.RelationTriple>> binaryRelations)
        Iterates through the binary relations of a sentence and determines if there is a literal in the object of the binary relation. (only dates and numbers) Finally tries to map the binary relation to an existing property.
        Parameters:
        entity - An entity which was found in the current sentence.
        i - Index of the current sentence.
        binaryRelations - List of binary relations in the current sentence.

      • checkKeywords

        private boolean checkKeywords​(Relation rel,
                              java.lang.String[] tripleR)
        Checks the words inside the predicate and object of the binary relation against the list of keywords for the current property.
        Parameters:
        rel - Current property.
        tripleR - Current binary relation.
        Returns:
        True if the keywords for the property match words inside the binary relation, false otherwise. (Sometimes more than one keyword has to be matched, specified for each property in the properties.json file)

      • mapNumber

        private int mapNumber​(java.lang.String objectLemmaGloss,
                      java.lang.String number)
        Tries to find the amount of zeros that have to be added to the given number, so it checks if there is a number keyword in the object of the relation.
        Parameters:
        objectLemmaGloss - Object of the current relation
        number - The number which was found on the object of the current relation.
        Returns:
        The amount of zeros that need to be added to the given number because of the occuring number keyword.

      • setLabelAndName

        private void setLabelAndName​(Entity entity)
        Creates two triples for the rdfs:label and foaf:name relation and the given entity.
        Parameters:
        entity - Current entity.

      • containsMonth

        private int containsMonth​(java.lang.String object)
        Checks if there is a month in the object of the current relation.
        Parameters:
        object - Object of the current relation.
        Returns:
        The number of the month in a year, 0 otherwise.
